# Introduction

Understanding the factors that drive the spread, societal and public health impacts, and the effects of mitigation efforts requires access to timely, well-documented, robust data resources. Through principled application of software best practices, we have collected, documented, and made available the most up-to-date resources tracking disease incidence, testing, comorbidities, demographics, and health impacts. Built using the R statistical programming language, we can immediately leverage the extensive set of epidemiologic modeling, machine learning, and visualization tools. By providing extensive worked examples of analysis, data exploration, and integration, we hope to empower existing data scientists to perform novel data fusions, produce reusable and portable data products. Capitalizing on an interest in learning data science and a large workforce faced with new working conditions, we aim to foster timely educational resources that build on existing datasets and research.
